reviewText:
Overlooked often. This is a bizarre world, unusual game, and even stranger story. The setting, and most characters, intertwining the events you move through, pretty linear, feels a bit dreamy, stream of conscious, Alice in Wonderland, and frankly, like a freak dream or hallucination.

The combat scenarios each have a twist and a few optional weapons but mostly its sock'm and bop'm down which is an oft underused style. No two enemies are exact clones, and the game is so relatively short that the combat won't get stale. Some fights can be more challenging than others but none are really a joke with all quite fun, and a few can be a challenge till you find the tactics and approach.

Pretty short with some re-playability but what is there had a lot of attention poured into it. Definitely a refreshing change and change of pace over many games and worth a look for just the art and story alone.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Zeno Clash is one of those games that I only played for a little bit, but I was glad for it. It's also a game that I might not fully understand, but I'm happy for its mere existence. It's so different and unusual in approach and design, yet it works rather well. Stuff like this proves that games don't all need to be high fantasy or military shooters to work.

The combat is simply awesome and sublime. Few games really give me that impression of walloping a mob in the face, but this game definitely delivers. I can feel that satisfying recoil with every hard crack of Ghat's fist, and kneeing a baddie in the face is a treat. Fighting is by no means easy, and some enemies are clever and know how to dodge and counter some of the moves. Others are armored, skillful or just plain weird, and you have to determine the correct approach to damage them effectively. This makes for a very tactical game where you have to be able to plan and improvise your attacks, as well as manage your health and stamina.

Weapons are provided, but just don't give that same amount of gratification. Luckily they are only needed for a couple key sections of the main game, and are completely optional at all other times. Most enemies can be beaten with bare knuckles.

My only gripe is really the length of the main campaign. It's a bit shorter than I would have preferred, considering the potential depth of the game's mechanics, not to mention the sheer alien beauty of the game's world. If nothing else I wanted to know more and more about the world, its bizarre creatures and history. Maybe this is expanded upon in the sequel.

There is, however, an interesting challenge" mode
date: which consists of a series of matches that get progressively harder
recommended: with the player facing various squads of enemies based on characters faced in the main game. Because of it's own length and the difficulties that can be reached
hoursPlayed: I get the impression that this tower mode is the "real" game
voteText: and the campaign is more of a lengthy tutorial.\n\nThis title isn't for everyone. This game requires some good tactical instincts and the combat can be a bit slower-paced that some would prefer
helpfulPercent: but if you like the tribal-punk setting and enjoy first-person brawling
votesHelpful: then you'll get your fix here."

reviewText: Easily one of the most original experiences I've ever seen in a PC game. Making a beat-em-up in a first-person situation was about as clunky as you could imagine, but it came out much better than you'd think. Still, it felt unfair and needlessly frustrating at times. It has a very 80s feel with the design looking like it came out of The Labyrinth and Dark Crystal with the tone of Mad Max and Water World. Zeno Clash is beautifully rendered too with the scenery and chaacter models ooking like they could actually have been made out of clay. The combat, which is the core gameplay, was solid and satisfying despite it's short comings. Never thought I could use the mouse and it feel like I'm really punching somebody! The voice acting is very flat and the story is very shallow, but the story didn't need to be very deep and the awkward voice acting added to the surreal and abstract feel of the whole thing. The music fit the atmosphere and the mood perfectly, similar to Abe's Odysee. I felt like that's probably the sounds you would hear in that universe. Zeno Clash is an easy recommendation for anyone looking for a fresh first person experience with some unique challenge.

reviewText: Fantastic game with a catchy soundtrack and surreal, weird, yet very engaging universe. The whole game is divided in around 20 little scenes, takes you about five hours. It's just the right length. The combat system is nicely done. There are only two big flaws with this game: it's a bit unoptimized (that's caused by the engine), and the voice acting falls short for the worst possible character: your sidekick.\n\nOverall, it's one of the best indie games of 2009 and you should definitely play it.

reviewText: This is a very... Unique game. The first person brawler combat is clunky, some fights are way too hard and crowded, the graphics are just ok and the voice acting is very bad at times. But I still recommend it simply because of the experience it is. The game is really short (finished it in one sitting) but it has one of those weird stories and takes place in such a strange land that you can't help but see it through. And at the end of the day, I had fun with it, which is all that really matters. Just don't get too aggravated when you die for the 6th time running around being chased by a pig-man and a rat-man while crazy people throw exploding skulls at you and you try to fight them off with guns made of fish bones. Yeah.

reviewText:
This game is cleverly designed. I was surprised to find that the first person fist fighting style of the game was executed so well that rather than being put off by the fists flying in front of my face, I ended up becoming absorbed in each fight, physically moving in my chair to dodge left and right.

Besides clever game design, the art style is remarkably unique. Characters, landscapes and monsters all look very strange, but always familiar. The story was also unexpectedly good. The protagonist presents the player with an intriguing new perspective. I've never seen similar in any other game.

I don't understand why this game isn't more well known.
I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys surrealist art, anthropology or beating people up.

reviewText: Zeno Clash is one of the most unique games I've ever played, and in a good way. The environments are beautifully surreal, the main combat focus (the hand-to-hand combat) works extremely well, and the punches you land really feel like they have weight behind them. Sending an opponent ragdolling away with an uppercut is a satisfying end to an individual encounter. The story, while weak, does a good enough job at tying each location into a coherent progression, though I'd have like some more explanation on the lore for the world of Zenozoik. But overall, this was a very fun game from start to finish.

reviewText:
Zeno Clash is a stage=based first-person brawler with occasional shooting segments, in contrast with many first-person shooters that have occasional brawling segments.  The player must use an arsenal of punches, kicks, and throws--along with the occasional club or primative firearm--in a robust combat system that requires proper positioning and timing in addition to good awareness of the surroundings, as the player is outmatched 3 to 1 in every fight if not worse, and the opponents are just as strong as them.  All this is set in a visually rich world that borrows from many ancient and tribal cultures, creating a unique immersive experience.

Approximate Length:  5-6 hours.  Additional arena challenges add a few more hours.

PROS
(+) World & character design is creative and genre-defying
(+) Accomodates a variety of combat playstyles
(+) Difficulty is well-balanced and punishes mistakes appropriately

CONS
(-) Enemy AI is simplistic and can easily be exploited
(-) Stages are often flat and open with minimal obstacles
(-) Plot is disjointed and many things are left unexplained
(-) Suffers from sporadic game lag even at low settings

OVERALL:  Zeno Clash is a weird" game
voteText: and even in the base concept of a first-person brawler.  Weird games are a good thing; it shows that game designers are being creative and testing the limits of what a game is
helpfulPercent: or what it can be.  However
votesHelpful: for all its creativiity Zeno Clash falls just short of a positive experience.  The combat system is enjoyable
votesTotal: but simplistic arenas and simplistic enemies that value quantity over quality quickly make it tedious
votesFunny: and the points it wins with its inventive setting are taken away by the fact that it ultimately does very little with it."

reviewText:
Regardless of some of the games shortcomings, this game is highly enjoyable with a very pleasurable 1st-person brawler experience makes for some very solid gameplay that is refreshing to enjoy.



I want to get right into things and talk about the combat first. The combat is fun and is surprisingly fluid. Probably one of my biggest issues with the combat system is the enemies invicible times. Enemies can always override your attacks but there's a lot of times when enemies will commit to a attack and are completely invincible. Making it so you take unncessary damage and it kind of ruins the flow of the game I found. Sometimes you can't even dodge their attack when executing a perfect dodge to counterattack. But overrall the combat is fair game.

In the combat you are either using your bare hands to beat the living snot out of your enemies in a awesome intense fashion, or you're picking their health off with a gun from afar.

The combat keeps it very simple with the controls but also makes for some intense fighting. It's really hard to explain how the combat controls work via text over doing a live commentary for example and talking about how they work in the game itself. But the game has a what I'd say fair learning curve with a stiff challenge you may not be prepared for in skill yet. But ultimately you'll learn how to conquer your foes even if it has you going back a chapter or two to do some training. Which really isn't that big of an issue since the fighting in this game is fun as heck. You'll give your old enemies the one-two-puncharoo and you'll pick up some knew combat techniques (skill specifically, the game locks some advanced combat early game. But all results in combat are based on your skill and use of the controls) and be trained enough to learn how to take out tougher enemies.


I liked the soundtrack, it wasn't perfect. But it was nice and I can remember a few specific tracks that fit my fancy. They fit the fighting scenarios well and they really helped you get into fights, I give them credit for making soundtracks that pumped me up some in a lot of these battles and levels.

The art directive was really strange, I wouldn't say it was memorable or enjoyable persay. But it was interesting to look at and look forward to for their next environments and people. Though I had an issue with the level designs. In the sense of the backgrounds. Everything a little above level eye sight which would be the middle of the screen was sickingly blurry. It was like this in pretty much every level. I had to keep my eyes on the ground and the middle of the screen or I felt sick.

The voice acting was poor in it's own right, but that doesn't really matter. Same with the story, the story was kind of weird and didn't really make any sense besides your were just running away from your home because of your actions. But the story and voice acting and art and some of the blurry vision in the levels really pale in how good the action in this game was.


I know I didn't do a good job at explaining the combat at all, i'd definitely suggest watching a video of it on youtube. But the action brawling in this game is really good fun. It was an experience I was happy to partake in and i'm glad I played this game.


I got this game through trading for it, for it was in a bundle. I heard the game was good and I gave it a try and i'm now here to tell you that is indeed the case. I'd suggest getting it price cut of at least above 5 bucks. Anything below that is just criminal. Though this game is priced at $9.99 or your regional equilivalent and I'd say this game is worth the full price. It's good and I can't say i'd feel bad if I dropped ten bucks on this game. Because even after beating the game there's a challenge mode in-which you beat the crap out of people for numerous amounts of floors and that's jolly good fun too.

So anyways, Zeno Clash. If you don't mind a game that is highly action-oriented and with great combat and that's very fast-paced and alive. Get this game, it's really enjoyable.



Anyways, thank you for reading my review. I hope you found it helpful for considering if you want to purchase this game or not, have a good one.

reviewText: I have to give this game a serious review because the game itself is almost a big joke. It's only a couple hours long and is therefore objectively a waste of money, but if you can get it for cheap or just play a friends copy then I'd recommend it simply for the really cool melee combat mechanics. There are weird guns and heavy melee weapons but that ♥♥♥♥ blows ♥♥♥ like the rest of the game and its nonsensical story, bad voice acting, ameteur animation, etc. The one true redeeming quality is the punching and it's worth trying out just to feel how great it is to uppercut chicken men six feet into the air.

reviewText: Zeno Clash is very unique game but will you want to play it ? In Zeno Clash you plays as Ghat. Hes on the run from his brothers and sisters after he kills Father Mother. The story is simple enough you would understand but overall the game feels lacking. The story in itself is quite good and the twist ending does keep things fresh. But now about the gameplay. The gameplay uses melee combat to youre advanted. You bassicly lock onto an enemy and then you beat him up. Of course there are guns you can use but those are worthless because enemys rush you so fast you wont have time to reload them. Overall Zeno Clash is a fresh spin to the FPS genre but i felt that it got boring after a while and the difficulty spikes are a great dissapointment . Overall if you can get it while its on sale go for it but for full price just skip it. I give Zeno clash a 6/10

reviewText:
I dreaded this moment for a long time. Zeno Clash. Oh my god, Zeno Clash. I don't even know what to say more. This is the most bat ♥♥♥♥ insane game I have played.

Story takes us to the past (future?) to the Zenozoic. Our hero, Gath, is dead. But he is not, and he killed some being called father-mother, and now half of the friggin world hates him, so he runs away, while having shroom infused dreams of his master which is also dead. And that my friends is not a spoiler. Thats 5 seconds of the game. I won't tell anything more about the story, because for starters its quite good, and besides it doesnt make any ♥♥♥♥ing sence. At all.

Gameplay is as basic as it gets. We are running around in beat em up style, throu the linear levels and kicks everything until it stops moving. Here and there we will encounter some kind of diversity (which boils down to doing exacly the same thing, but with weapon). Its a classic beat em up with fps POV. Thats the whole shmuck here! That being said, ZC is HAAAARD. First stages are quite easy, even on harder difficulties, but after about hour in, when all of our moves are unlocked to us (and to our enemies), it gets really insane. AI is really good, it tries to play on our disadvantages by ganging up on us, dodging, blocking, all that kind of stuff. Even weapons can't help us, when we have low health and we get surrounded. And don't even get me started on the whole tower" thing (its basically a survival mode)

reviewText:
Personal Rating: Grab it during a massively discounted sale"
Traditional Rating: 4/10
Genre: First Person Brawler

I really tried hard to love Zeno Clash - granted the story it tells is certainly innovative and hats off to the developers for bringing something different to the gaming medium - but I just couldn't get into it. I am not going to not recommend you give the game a go even though I have rated it with a non-recommendation because this is probably just due to my personal tastes and since everyone's taste does differ there is a good possibility you could walk away really loving this title.

Set in a far away fantasy world the game makes use of the Source Engine from Valve to tell its tale and it looks pretty decent and runs easily on modern machines. The fantasy world created is quite eye-catching but that was not nearly enough to keep me invested in the game which I found to be dreadfully boring and far too hipster for its own good. Even the convoluted story involving your character and his accidental killing of a creature known as Father-Mother and his then flight from the town he once called home all the while being pursued by his brother and sisters who are hot on his heels with the intention to kill him didn't really resonate with me either. I didn't really enjoy the fighting mechanics and got more frustrated with the game as time moved on.

Don't go by what I say as anything gospel since there are many out there who absolutely adore this little title and you may end up being one of them. It's just not for me!"

reviewText:
One of my favorite games ever.
I loved it because it innovated and took fighting to FPS view - it might not have done so amazingly, but it felt great because it was new and fresh.
But the combat is only what led me into the game - not what made me stay. The story and design is what made me stay.
Sure - the voice acting is pretty sub par - but with what they got, they painted a amazingly detailed and enthralling world.
The characters are unique and interesting and the overall story (once pieces falls into place) is really intruiging.
Loved the first one - definitly a recommend - provided you can hold on once the combat charm starts wearing off.

if nothing else, do pick this up at a sale.

A fast paced brawler that reminded me of older games with a nice mix of hard fighting and annoying rules. A good game by it's own right when you're able to take the bitter pills it makes you swallow. Almost all the combat is hand-to-hand fighting with some guns to play with. This makes for the funnest part of the game play, hard hitting and somewhat tactical combat that you can really get stuck into. However, a boring rail shooting level and 'oh so exciting' sewer level creep in to muck up some ofthe gameplay. The occasional big 'brute' style enemy pops up to force you to play whack-with-stick combat that slows down gameplay annoyingly. HOWEVER, for the fun of the main combat, which you do the most, it's a worthwhile game for the fun brawling focus. Oh, and the story is kinda neat, even if it's really kinda screwy.

Pro:
-Dayum that brawling combat is fun
-The story's twist is kind of interesting, even if...

Con:
-... It's easy to forget it during the fighting.
-Brutes are annoying to fight, but not THAT unpleasant

Of note:
-Most bosses force you to fight with ranged weapons to beat them, a few force you to know the counter system well without forcing you to use it.
-The game's got a decent tutorial that's broken up a bit.
-The game is as weird as it is in the screenshots, but it's not THAT 'weird'. Except the storyline is.

Totally worth the price!  Really unique and strangely gorgeous game.  Challenging to the point of frustration in places, but the story is interesting enough to make you want to see it through.\n\nNothing else like it, check it out!

Mais um jogo finalizado aqui. Então, vamos lá.
Este não é um jogo muito grande. Apresenta de 3 a 5 horas no modo campanha.
Tendo mais algumas horas no modo Challenge, que é realmente um desafio.

A história é muito doida e bizarra, vale a pena conferir, pois sai daquela rotina de jogos americanos e japoneses. O cenário é muito bonito, um mundo de fantasia totalmente maluco, com criaturas e costumes próprios.
É um jogo bem diferente, e recomendo que comprem em alguma promoção e que só comprem se realmente curtirem jogos com uma temática diferente.

Eu gostei muito do jogo apesar de ser bem curto, achei a história bem legal e bem maluca, por isso recomendo. Mas recomendo a pessoas que curtam essa temática, lembrem-se disso.

This is an extremely unique first person brawler by an indie Chilean devellopment team. The bizarre Cenozoic setting and even more bizarre character designs flow on amazing fever-dream-logic. The combat is both visceral and substantial, and the individual characters, who you'll likely be seeing a lot of, have very satisfying reactions on their faces to an unexpectedly vicious assault. While the voice acting can be extremely hit-or-miss, the plot itself is both memorable and appropriately bizarre.

Very much appreciated the story and the ~4 hours worth of game play, any longer and it would have been draining. Will be keen to try the second one.\nIf you like strange; as I do, play this!
One of the best inde games I've ever played.

This game is an underrated gem. It's a first-person beat-em-up. Though I will say that some of the production could have been tighter, primarily in character animation, the surreal plot, characters, setting and gameplay are a great change of pace from the orange-and-blue that AAA studios love.

I completed the game and tried bit of the arena, I like the impression it made on me.
Don't expect 3rd gen quality. Textures lack a bit here and there, same as the world detail level which is quite simplistic overall but with use of blur, fog, lightning and interesting surreal design the game manages to conceal it perfectly and it definitely works for me. Character design is again simplistic yet amazing and fairly high detailed at some parts.
Combat and enemies are bit repetitive but challenging in a good way. Game sets you up against them in slightly different situations and environment and again manages to conceal what it’s lacking.
Story is nicely confusing but lacking emotionally a little. Then again it's a surreal universe and who know what mentality and emotional approach people might have there.
Music is nothing out of the ordinary and could be better but it corresponds with the action rather well.
Game doesn’t seem to suffer from any major bugs, definitely nothing that couldn't be solved with quick load. I got stuck once trough the cause of the whole game and once my enemy got stuck outside of the fight area and I had to bounce grenades of the wall to kill him around the corner as he was out of my reach.
This brings us to the level design that is simplistic, linear and not at all open world like but it serves the games purpose. Which in my opinion is to tell a surreal story that you could then tell to your children for not such a good night sleep :)
Story is interesting and bit surreal with a solid ending, yet PG12 or less. The game overall is very short which is disappointing, but it includes survival arena like mode for those that would like to experience the game bit more.
Overall 7 out of 10. Game is solid but lacks in graphic, music, emotional storytelling, enemies and weapon varieties level design and game length. Seems it is a low budget game, yet it has a similar effect on me that Dreamfall - The Longest Journey or Bioshock had back when I played them - somehow enchanting. It manages to conceal its flaws with overall good concept, solid design and interesting fighting system. It brings a bit of fresh air in to the FPS genre, and with its low price it's a must have.
This game is weird. But awesome. Buy it.

*Possible Spoilers Below, but not really*

Punched my way to the literal end of the earth and back in about 3 hours.
Enjoyed every second of it. Dont let the short length fool you. This is a fun pc beat em up shooter thing!
A few fights are quite tough, the weapons are interesting, your female sidekick has smoking hot legs and gives you something to stare at while out and about doing your thing, and the story didnt really confuse me at all, there are some things not explained and im sure the sequel will adress those things but what you are presented with while weird, does eventually peace together, leaving some remaining questions after the cliff hanger ending. LIKE!

Why does this world even exist in the first place, and why so many strange creatures along side humans.

What exactly was mother father doing before the intro scene that kicks all this stuff off, i mean sure we get a semi answer, but still. Like what? Wheres the motive.

Are the 2 main characters going to get it on and have like a son or something. Im sure theres already fan fiction of that. Wouldnt shock me.

How many punches would it take to get to the centre of the planet? ID LIKE TO KNOW!

And what are all those things we were promised info on in the end of the game, sequel perhaps? (downloading the second game as i type this)

ANYWAYS, silly questions about a silly but entertaining plot aside. Just uh, buy this ok. Seriosly get both. I want a third game. I want a nice ZENO TRILOGY, to come back to and enjoy. 2 OUT OF 3 FOLKS. JUST ONE MORE GAME AND THE DREAM WOULD BECOME REAL! LEZ GO NOW!

Zeno Clash is fun, surreal, and short game that's worth the price.

The combat works well with a focus on melee, but it incorporates weapons in a way that balances out the combat.
The game is short though. I beat it in 3.5 hours without trying to get the achievments, but it does have a challenge mode where you fight multiple rounds of enemies. Since the fighting is so much fun the challenge mode adds a lot in terms of time you will be playing it.
Aesthetically every character and location is as surreal as the trailers show, even their voices and manner of speaking have quirky qualities to them, though it could get iritating.
Still it is worth the price.

It's a weird, frustrating, repulsive and beautiful game that will stick with me for a long time. It's not like anything you've played before, from the brawling gameplay to environments that seem drawn alternately from dreams, '60s sci-fi, and the artist getting sunstroke at a busy farm. The game is suggestive and evokes more than it tells, but there seems to be an underlying logic to the enigma of a story on which the game's journey is built. I highly recommend this game. It's cheap, and worth the 5-6 strange hours you'll put into it.

This game contains a unique and interesting universe that I wish I could explore more. The gameplay mainly consists of first-person fighting, and is pretty fun.  The story is interesting and unique. Play this game.

This was actually a surprisingly good game. Its a bit weird in its setting and characrters, but the combat was fantastic and the story was surprisingly well done for a fighting game. Personally, I enjoyed the creativity that  went into the world and character design but it may not be for everyone. An interesting sidenote is that it is built on Valve's Source Engine, which means the graphics have aged very well and it is moddable. Overall, I highly recommend it if you want a well made beat-em-up. 7-10 Stars

Very off the wall, unusual First Person Beat-'em up, worth a gander before the biggerer and betterer sequel comes along.  Also, 'cos it's Source-based, runs well on most older PCs.\n\nCompletey barmy in parts but that's part of the attraction!

I went into this game blind and cranky and came out happy. I know because when I first looked at it I did not expect much but damn. I enjoyed the hell out of it even tho i can nitpick at some things story has been done but whatever. It was fun punching and kicking the living ♥♥♥♥ out of everything even the animals chickens, pigs, and rabbits. But the heavy duty guys. I even punched the father mother to death intill I had to put a cap in his knee. If that sentence doesnt want you to play this game then well i dont what else to say. Also the negative level of tower of champion was my favorite part.

Zeno Clash is good because it's interesting, and not because it's particularly well made. It doesn't prooperlysupport controllers without some config file tweaking and even then you need a mouse to load your save. The easy difficulty can get pretty hard and autosaves can put you in a tough spot (fortunately, there's two so you can go back a bit further).

The combat is interesting, although I found it hard to dodge because it's a two-action sequence (block and then move) instead of a chord or single button. For controller users, there's no auto-aim for ranged weapons, I couldn't get the sensitivity low enough for precise aiming, and the reticle is hard to see so shooting can be difficult.

There's other minor things that feel unpolished like delays after finishing a fight where nothing happens and the bad voice acting of the main character, but I still like Zeno Clash because it feels so different. Your companion's voice acting is great, many of the other characters are good, the mix of melee and ranged combat works well enough, the world is beautiful and strange, and the struggle of the protagonist (while not sold through the acting) is interesting and isn't the standards save-the-world cliche.

I finished the game on easy with a controller, but used buddha mode (through the console) to get through some tough battles (like the infuriating Hunter).

This game offers unique characters, story and gameplay. I'll be the first to admit, the game has a weak shooting system. But the melee combat is where it's at. The game has a feel like no other. Plus the really intricate and (sometimes crazy) story will keep you playing till the very short end.

I would recomend this game if you're looking for a different kind of shooter with meele combat along with it. It has a unique art style, which is very tripy, that works really well with the gameplay. -Not to sound like a pothead or anything, but playing this game under the influence of the green is awesome- Dialogues are O.K. I guess... Gameplay is gold.\n\nI'd give it a 8/10, considering they approched shooters in a different way.

A brutal, punkish, insane fantasy world awaits you in Zeno Clash.

This is a crazy world, where they use animals for weapons, bizarre creatures walk and talk around you, and nobody owns a ♥♥♥♥ing comb.

It also has some of the most brutal and visceral hand-to-hand combat I've ever experienced in a game.

In this game you play a man banished from his family, return to confront his progenitor, only to be thrust into a situation which forces him to fight for his life.

In his quest he faces his malformed brethren, the insane denizens of the nearby forest, and abominations from a time long past.


The game is held back in a few points, the voice-acting is a bit wonky, most likely due to the fact that none of the voice actors are native english speakers, but this is easy to ignore due to how ♥♥♥♥ING BIZARRE all the characters are anyway.

The thing that makes this game is the combat, it is intense. No. Really.

Give it a try.  It's a helluva ride.

Zeno Clash is a rather unique take on the first-person view one commonly sees nowadays in the FPS genre. It's a first-person fighter, where the player ends up using his fists more than handmade weapons. The world of Zenozoic is one where metal is hardly seen; in its place is bone, stone and preserved guts, forming an incredibly strange world where clans vie for power. Rooster blood has the same effect as alcohol here and everyone knows fisticuffs - coincidence? I think not. The storyline seemed a bit lacking, but the gameplay is where it's at. A challenge worthy of any gamer worth his salt.

To me, Zeno Clash is the epitome of what an Indie Game is supposed to be. It's completely out of left field, the mechanics are unpolished and (occasionally) legitimately buggy, but the whole thing is so interesting and odd that you can't help but have an incredible time playing it.\n\nHonestly, I thought the game was fantastic and highly recommend it (I don't know if that really came through in the above) - just don't expect Skyrim!
I don't know what I'm playing when I boot this game up, but I do know it's amusing.

I even punched the father mother to death intill I had to put a cap in his knee. If that sentence doesnt want you to play this game then well i dont what else to say. Also the negative level of tower of champion was my favorite part.

Take Mad Max, Dragonheart, and the Island of Dr Moreau and blend them all together and you'll come up with a game called Zeno Clash. The combat takes place from a first person perspective and allows for complex moves such as dodging and parrying. You get the option of using either your fists/melee or guns in most battles although some will limit you to one or the other. Story-wise, this game is pretty simplistic but the level and character design more than make up for it with some absolutely stunning yet totally bizarre visuals. The only detractor from the overall experience is that the voice acting is a bit corny and the game is fairly short. Definitely worth picking up at a fair price.

There are no words to properly describe how deeply bizzare this game is. The setting is outlandish, the story is walking the edge of complete insanity and the characters are probably the strangest albiet the most well imagined I've ever seen in a game.

That said, the brawler combat is quite fun and, although the play through is rather short it is a fun and memorable experience.

I'm really glad I played this game.

Zeno Clash was developed by ACE Team, an entertainment software developer based in Santiago, Chile.  They're committed to making unique games that stand out for their originality and quality.

Zeno Clash is exactly that; the use of the Source engine makes for excellent graphics and  a quality feel, while it's unique art style, story line, and melee combat system really sets this game apart from your typical half-♥♥♥♥♥ console port.

JohnCover gives you his recommendation.

This is a First Person Brawler with a simple combat system, original and out of the ordinary art style. Featuring a 2-3 hour story mode and another hour of challenges.

Graphics: The game uses the Source engine (Half Life 2) so it has limited but memorable scenes. The art style is astonishing and  aestheticly looks like a wierd dream.
I really want to see the concept arts or a sketchbook from the creator. Technically the game looks okay. There are low res textures, jerky shadows and low poly stuff. But the caracter design, the weapons and the environment...man this game looks and feels really uniqe.

Sound: The music just like the graphics fullfills this wierd dreamy athmosphere. There are many memorable moments thank to the great combination of them. Voice acting is cheesy but funny. The dialogues are genuinely funny and serious at the same time. The sound effects are basic public domain stuff.

Gameplay: Gameplay wise well... it's simple. The main scenario is arena fight. You get to a locked area and you have to defeat all the enemies. Imagine these like nodes in a graph. These nodes are connected by edges that are basically linear paths. And overall the game is linear and the level design is linear too.
There is a turret section as well but still has the stong dreamy athmosphere so it's okay. You will encounter little enemies, normal enemies, normal enemies with weapons (melee, ranged), brutes and bosses.
The little enemies are crabs, chickens and those big rabbit thingys. I think most of them just spit you acid liquid. Normal enemies are basically fighting partners. These guys can pick up weapons as well. Enemy vaiety is nice here because there are different models and fighting styles. Brutes are big, tough enemies and you better kill 'em with melee weapons. They take multiple hits as well. Bosses are easy battles, just like old times: wasd 'em and shoot 'em.
You can shoot only in ADS otherwise you swing the weapon towards the enemy. You can throw the weapons as well. Mechanically these are the same as in other games but they feel strange and uniqe in a positive way.
The melee system is simple and easy to learn. There are basic combos and advanced combos. The game does a good job teaching you these things in the tutorial sessions. There is a challenge tower for pro players. It's basically a fight fest. You have to climb the tower and defeat all the enemies. Things could get hard here... :)

Replayability: As I mentioned the Singleplayer story mode is linear and each replay will be the same. But if you liked the story and the wierd things in it, I'm sure you'll give it another go. However the Challenge Tower is pure gameplay and fun and absolutely replayable.

Overall:  Pros:
Short but entertaining Singleplayer mode
Visceral combat
Simple and fun melle system
Uniqe aesthetics
Interesting art style
Dreamy music
Cons:
Short Singleplayer mode
Lack of MP features
Mediocre sound effects
Nothing special in technical level
Linear levels

Verdict: A nice game from the indie developer, Ace Team. I had great fun with it.
I recommend this game for those who like fighting games, wierd fiction, and for those who's time is short and want a short game.

This game is extremely underrated. Do yourself a favor and play it just to, at the very least, experience an fps like no other on the market. Unique and amazing, best FPS experience I've had in years.
Awesome game, wish they would make a sequel.
Incredibly beautiful. Excellent game! Gameplay itself is not perfect (and sometimes annoying), but still pretty good. A great game.

Weeeird. This might be one of the weirdest games on Steam. I can't even begin to describe just how weird it is. You'll just have to play it. It's a fun game with some pretty engaging melee combat. I'd say it's well worth your time just because it's so unique.
This is one of the most original and zany First Person Shooters I've played.\n\nPlay it, and you'll wonder why hand-to-hand combat isn't handled similarly to this in every game.
Unlike the sequel, which is a real shame, original Zeno Clash is a well focused first-person brawler with a strong anarchistic spirit that goes through its world and characters. Tastes quite spicy!
Fun game, great value, and it can be verey challenging. ENJOY
This game is pretty much what you'd expect from a ten year old in a creative writing class. Hackneyed, cliché, nonsensically creative, and lots--I mean, LOTS--of violence.\n\nIt's good.

The main thing that I've taken from this game is an unwarranted desire to punch every parrot I see.\n\nZeno Clash is a super-funky post-post-Apocalyptic first person fighter that looks like it came out of the Jim Henson studio.  If you can get it on sale, get it on sale.  It's particularly short, and it doesn't blaze any new trails, but the trails it follows are memorable and colorful.  It's Psychonauts strange, if not Psychonauts well-written.

Zeno Clash is a rather unique take on the first-person view one commonly sees nowadays in the FPS genre. It's a first-person fighter, where the player ends up using his fists more than handmade weapons. The world of Zenozoic is one where metal is hardly seen; in its place is bone, stone and preserved guts, forming an incredibly strange world where clans vie for power. Rooster blood has the same effect as alcohol here and everyone knows fisticuffs - coincidence? I think not. The storyline seemed a bit lacking, but the gameplay is where it's at. A challenge worthy of any gamer worth his salt.
Intense combat.  Twisted story and psychotic characters.  Very creepy musical score.  For those of you sick people out there; you gotta try it.

Quite a fun game

I Think this is the first Brawler FPS I have played..

I think I brought it for $1 when it was on special.. Its not worth $9.99 But if you see it for $2.50 or less go for it..
Heyyo, interesting adventure fps game... sometimes it gave me a headache though... not sure why... framerate? not sure... but I had fun with this game.

I just realized I hadn't reccomended this game, and was astonished.

Zeno Clash is a first person fighting game made in the source engine.
Yes, First Person Fighting.
I'm gonna make this short

The fighting is superb, unless you're one of those people that spam the same attack over and over again because it works, then it'll be boring and tedious to do a super punch every 5 seconds. The bit of gunplay you do have, works in nicely. The bosses are unique and different, and you don't spend the whole game punching things in the face, either. The plot is strange, but fantastic, and the lore behind the game is... unique.

TL:DR Punch wierd bird people in the face

This indie treat brought good first person melee to us before mainstream games started to do it well.  It also did it with style and originality.  The art style got it accolades.  FFS, it's 75% off at the moment.  Everyone should own it.
A true gem! Apart from the obvious wtf" aspect of the art style (contestant for the best use of Source 2date imo) & the bizarre characters & story
date: this game has a hand 2 hand combat system that can put 3A titles to shame. While ranged and melee weapons are present the heart of the combat lies in good ol' fist fights
recommended: where you have to be thinking on your feet in order to survive. It is amazing how they've managed to make each part of the h2h combat system tacticaly valid
hoursPlayed: esp block/evade where usualy one option tends to overshadow the other. Hits also have some "weight" to them as opponents will react accordingly to each thumping blow.  Another + is the iclusion of a tower mode where you'll be focusing solely on the combat. Only drawback is the game's length: approx 5 hrs for the sp story. All in all one of the most unique games out there. Def give this 1 a shot!"
votesTotal: No ratings yet

reviewText: Goofy story, but awesome combat system. When you play it's hard not to feel like a badass. Definite buy.

A really non-traditional story here will a lot of unconventional gameplay.  It's largely melee based combat and it has a really good feel.  The story really is far out there but ACE Team did a great job bringing the madness to a close at the end.  I really enjoyed the game, though it's mostly an on-rails experience.

Doing the ladder missions is really awesome and gives you a lot of room to experiment with all the different melee attacks you've learned throughout the game.

I'd recommend this game to anyone even at full price.  It's worf it.
Great game. Gorgeous and bizzare look and plot with fun, visceral first-person brawling.
Zeno Clash is a weird game.  Weird" is definitely the best adjective to describe it.  It's an odd game with odd characters in an odd world.  The game is made in the Source Engine
date: but the visuals are strikingly different from other games from the same engine
recommended: like Half Life 2 or Vampire: The Masquerade.  The game is a string of arcade-esque fights with guns and fists
hoursPlayed: all in first-person.  Zeno Clash is actually one of the only games to do fist fighting correctly in first person
voteText: and it does it well.  While Zeno Clash is very short
helpfulPercent: the story clocking only three to four hours
votesHelpful: it does have a challange mode and varying difficulty levels.  Even if it costs too much at full price
votesTotal: it's undoubtably worth it on sale."
commentsCount: true

reviewText:
An excellent Indie-Game based on the Source Engine with gripping first-person melee combat and a deep storyline set in a stone age fantasy world.
Unfortunately the voice acting (luckily english only) is not as good as you could be familiar with from other games.
Another disadvantage is the fact that shooter experienced players can finish it in 5 hours (or less).
There is a challenge mode where you can proof your melee combat skills and allows you to post your highscore in your Steam Friends network.

If you are looking for some hours of fun, excitement and brawl in an odd fantasy world, Zeno Clash is _the_ game for you xD
I love this combat, the universe, graphics, story and everything! Great game with great price - must buy.
I'm not one to play a game for its artistic aspects, but this one feels so out there, you have to see it!
Highly recommend this weird masterpiece. Great visuals, nice combat system + time challenges to compete with friends.

If you like great stories, and crazy art.. then this is a must buy!\nI had lots of fun with it. One of those games that you just can't wait to finish to see the ending (when you actually start understanding what's going on... like after 15 minutes in)
Worth the $10 they're asking for it. It's a brawler on psychodelic drugs. Fun and challenging, with a play style that I've not ever seen before.

I really recommend it for having a fascinating style, funky story, and just to see that First-Person-Beat-Em-Up (FPBEM?) can be done well! :D
A much better solo FPS" challenge experience than lots of other games
I've played like all the CODs etc.
It's a real shame there are no co-op modes on the PC though (only on 360) but I don't want to pay the inflated 360 price just for those few extra co-op levels :("

Zeno Clash is a First-Person-Fighter whose faults (including short playtime--I did it in about 3 hours--and sometimes irritating combat) are well outshone by its strange visuals and setting. Zeno Clash uses Fantasy to its best potential and rather than stuff more Orcs, Elves, and Dwarves down your throat it comes up with a wholly unique setting that is both striking and at time mesmerizing. To give you an idea of what the game is really like, I'll quote my favorite piece of dialogue. The Corwids are not slaves of reality; so they can be insane... Here I met Oxameter. Oxameter just walks in a straight line without letting anything change his path
date: and that's what Oxameter does. There was also Helim. Helim needed to be invisible
recommended: so he removed the eyes from anything that could see him.""

reviewText: This game will suck you into its immersive alien world and won't let you go till the bitter end! Super art, lush sounds and satisfying fisty cuff gameplay!
Really underrated game but really good! Give it a try!

Pros: Clashes were numerous
Cons: Could use more clashes

Recomendation: MORE CLASHES

Got this on sale for 99 cents during the Winter Sale. I bought it with money I got from selling Winter TF2 Crates on the Marketplace. Totally worth it. Great game, really friggen weird but captivating. The setting and atmosphere is intoxicating and made me play from begining to end in two sittings. The combat is brutal and has a great learning curve that made me feel like I was improving every time I lost a fight. Get this game.
Extremely well thought-out story and an insanely crazy world.\nWonderfull singelplayer game!
This sums it the best.\nhttp://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=142559312\nplus a cool strange art style.
If Hieronymus Bosch were a Chilean game developer setting out to make a first-person brawler, this is the game he would have made.
I thought the fighting and the physics engine used in this game were phenominal. Story was great, I loved the personalities of the characters and I thought it was an overall great game.

I would recomend this game if you're looking for a different kind of shooter with meele combat along with it. It has a unique art style, which is very tripy, that works really well with the gameplay. -Not to sound like a pothead or anything, but playing this game under the influence of the green is awesome- Dialogues are O.K. I guess... Gameplay is gold.\n\nI'd give it a 8/10, considering they approched shooters in a different way.

A brutal, punkish, insane fantasy world awaits you in Zeno Clash.

This is a crazy world, where they use animals for weapons, bizarre creatures walk and talk around you, and nobody owns a ♥♥♥♥ing comb.

It also has some of the most brutal and visceral hand-to-hand combat I've ever experienced in a game.

In this game you play a man banished from his family, return to confront his progenitor, only to be thrust into a situation which forces him to fight for his life.

In his quest he faces his malformed brethren, the insane denizens of the nearby forest, and abominations from a time long past.


The game is held back in a few points, the voice-acting is a bit wonky, most likely due to the fact that none of the voice actors are native english speakers, but this is easy to ignore due to how ♥♥♥♥ING BIZARRE all the characters are anyway.

The thing that makes this game is the combat, it is intense. No. Really.

Give it a try.  It's a helluva ride.
Its Crazy, doesn't make any sense, but it is totally awesome!
I'm not going to even write a proper review. This is one of the most unique games I've played in a long while, buy it, play it, get confused and enjoy it.

Do you like punching things in the face?
How about NPCs that are entirely insane?
Weapons that flat out do not make sense?

You should play this game then. 80% of the game is spent punching things, the other 20% is spent travelling between areas to punch things in, and 100% of the things you're going to be punching are entirely cracked in the head.

Fun game with a decent (and entirely unique) story.
Good game short time ... !!
it's a game
Great Game!
Fun and unusual. Try it!
Holy ♥♥♥♥ I feel like a badass ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ like Clint Eastwood knockin gooks in the face with my ultra fist of doom. 10/10

A truly enjoyable game, and one of the first to centre around melee fighting using Valve's Source engine. This game has the whole package: good, fantastical story, great music and sound effects, and inspired voice acting. Once you beat the single-player game (probably around 4-6 hours depending on your difficulty), there's a great Tower Challenge game that will really test how good of a fighter you are. If you can, crank up the graphics settings to really take in the landscapes and textures.

For me, Zeno Clash wasn't a game; it was an experience. It was as if Jim Henson made some alternate universe based around The Dark Crystal. It was awesomely weird, super imaginative, and fantastically engrossing. I will long remember my experience playing Zeno Clash.
FPP! FIRST PERSON PUNCHING!

I don't even know how to describe this.  Its weirdness, unique world setting, and terrible voice-acting all sort of give you this charming modern take on river city rampage meets mike tyson's punch-out.  Its a graphically rich head-trip.  (8/10)
An excellent first person brawler set in imaginative and bizzare landscapes. The combat flows well and allows you to literally bash people all the way across the field. All in all an excellent game.

Mechanics: It's a melee brawler with some wierd but cool looking guns. The fist fighting it really good and I couldn't ask any more or less from it. The guns seem to act like they should: Wood, bones, stone, and some metal all clashed together to make some kind of contraption that shoots skulls or stones.
Pacing: It gives you a typical tutorial but makes it a little funny (Useing headless chickens as target practice) and it goes by fairly quickly. You are met with actual combat about a couple minutes into the game and it is challenging and fun. After some 1 v 3 or 1 v 1 fights you are met with a boss, it isn't too hard but it's not too easy so it's a good fight. The pacing in this game seems pretty good and introduces things to you at a good rate.
Story: You somehow killed your mother and father and you millions of sisters and brothers are coming to get revenge. They send everything at you to stop you while you escape with what I presume is one of your sisters or a loved one. Voice acting is meh but I don't see that as a bad or a good thing. The story over all seems decent and is sure to be an enjoyable one.
Summary: The game so far is very enjoyable. The combat is good and it keeps things new and fun. The story is nothing to praise but it is at least enjoyable. Overall the game is pretty good with few to no problems. I did expirence some lightless ragdolls while I was playing but that is not too big. Graphically, you should't expect much: It's a source game, from and indie dev, and it was made some years back.
8/10: Really good game with little problems, it's melee combat is really nice and it's an enjoyable expirence.

To clarify: 9/10: spectacular, 10/10 Perfect with little to no problems and was fun and enjoyable throughout every piece of the game. A 5/10 would be like: It's mechanics do what they are suppose to do and the game does nothing special in general. 1/10 would be: I only enjoyed one small part of this game. 0/10 would be KILL ME AND THIS GAME. 8/10 simply just means that It had good mechanics but had nothing special in some other things.
Pretty solid First-Person-Brawler with a innovative game design. Relatively linear and short, but definitely fun.

This game is nearly as unique as its environment. It's a first person puncher set int a world that nobody has seen before. It has the potential to change your nightmares and dreams just by looking at the first level. But they didn't stop at just making everything look amazing and unique. They instead went further, making it an excellent fighitng game. While some parts are poorly made, the vast majority of the game is excellent and due to the relatively bite sized episdes of the game, you'll never find yourself hating the game over these small frustrations. If you don't trust me, at least try the demo and you'll see how much stress relief there is for punching a bird in the face. Over and over.

Game mechanics are not perfect and some little bugs are present. FPS elements are definetely rare, because for most of the time you have to fight with bare hands, in an interesting combat mode.

Considering this, big strenghts of the game are the fascinating, somewhat artistic game environment; and the narrative, which has an original surprise ending and the flavour of a strange, violent and striking fairy tale.

8/10

This game is just weirdly addicting. I enjoyed the art style, although very strange, and I thought that the combat was satisfying. Although it's fairly short, I was happy with the game over-all and it left me wanting to play the second game. The story is very weird and possibly off putting to some, (warning: you will fight the same people over and over, but in different circumstances and with new challenges added in) but it comes together in the end fairly well and can be challenging at times.  Seeing as like only 5 guys made this game I was thoroughly impressed and glad that I played it. I'm looking forward to playing the second installment in the coming months. I got them both on a Humble Bundle sell and so far my money was definitely well spent.

ZenoClash is one of those rare games in the industry which doesn't just play follow the leader. It is a truely innovative game and I found it to be a very enjoyable experience.
To briefly describe the gameplay, imagine a wrestling game crossed with a first person shooter and dipped in a vat of Salvador Dali's immagination. Basically there are a series of battles in which you use your fists, kicks, grabs and sometimes weapons, both melee and ranged. The systems are complex and feel really rewarding when mastered.  Some may find the systems a little difficult to master, I know it took me several hours of gameplay to begin to feel competent. If you enjoy a challenge that shouldn't put you off this game.
The setting is spectacular, very odd and unique and not an art style you see in many games. The world is rich and although there is not a lot of story the world itself and the design of the world makes the game a richer experience.
Ran out of room, verdict, BUY IT!
An unique first person brawler.

By far the most best and most satifying fps combat i've played in a game.  Stylized visuals looks fantastic and run smoothly the source engine never ceases to amaze me.  The settings and story are very wierd but thats all part of the aluure of this game defintly worth picking up hope they make a zeno clash 2!
Combine the Neverhood with Dark Messiah and asian fighting games and you got Zeno Clash. Great simplistic fighting system with great graphics and an interesting story. Set in a strange world.

Pros-:

Cheap, Great graphics (source engine), Great story (very weird aswell!), Great combat

Cons-:

Small areas, loads of irrelavant cutscenes, will damage your keyboard (allot of key pressing during combat!)

In conclusion a great game everyone should play :)
Punch mentally deficient furries in the face. Then knee them (also in the face).

Zeno Clash really was, and still is, a joy to play through from start to finish. The surprisingly well done first person brawling is a blast but the story and game-world would probably be where Zeno Clash shines the most. The environments are all exquisitely crafted and manage to pull of a bizarre yet beautiful atmosphere. If you haven't picked up this rather unique game yet I would highly recommend it.

Zeno Clash is a strange tale. It keeps the player's attention with the strange environment and captive story. While the graphics aren't stunning compared to games like Skyrim, it does have a unique approach that feels so realistic. It's a creative game that may be a bit short, yet in and of itself is very filling.\n\nI highly suggest buying it, and the sequal. Both are great games that have a great story.

Crazy, but interesting, game. It's a first-person fighter, really. There are sometimes guns that you can pick up and use, but they are something you'll probably pick up, shoot, then toss instead of reloading. The world is bizarre and wonderful to be in. The story itself is quite intersting. And, of course, the art of everything in this game is just so amazing. It's just a really fun, out-there kind of game. Note that it can be difficult sometimes, and you'll really need to learn how to block and counter moves if you want to succeed.

tl;dr
Good game. Buy it.
Atmospheric and truly original.\nIt ♥♥♥♥s PC gamers in the butt, though, by releasing extra content (and multiplayer!) for the consoletards, but nothing for the PC version.

This is a great game that seems to go un-noticed by many. I had tons of fun playing this and really pushed through to the ending to see what the story was all about. Fun gameplay and interesting story make this game a hit.

Weird and wonderful. There really isn't a universe like the one featured in Zeno Clash, and that coupled with the most robust first person fisticuff system makes for one hell of a game. Bonus: The challenge towers are a ton of fun.
Beautiful, strange, crazy world. Creative storyline and flexible combat. A very very great game!!!

An awesome indie first-person fighting game. Awesome world, environment, characters.. everything about this game is top-notch. The fighting is done in a clever and enjoyable way. It doesn't take very long to beat, however.
Short game beatable in one sitting with some of the most creative art I've ever seen in a game. The fighting is visceral and the plot is unique and thought-provoking.
Overflowing with creativity. Truly unique!

Pros: Bizarre, unexpected, tons of personality and a lot of fun. Visceral first-person melee mechanics make combat very unique and engaging. Nightmarish character design and creepy voicework contributes highly to the game's fascinatingly surreal ambience.

Cons: The small levels and strict linearity in progression are disappointing since the world's imaginative environments would be a blast to explore. Also, gamplay can feel repetitive at times since other than dialogue, there is little to break up the consecutive bouts of combat. Some elements of adventuring and exploration would add much to the experience. The game is a bit on the short side with the main story clocking in at about 4-5 hours.

Overall, Zeno Clash is well worth playing and is an experience that is sure to stick with you. I hope there is a sequel.

If you're in the mood for the bizarre you have to try this game. It is set in a fantastical fantasy world with environment and creatures unlike anything I've ever seen. Although there are a few weapons in the game the combat system is centered around melee combat. The system felt slightly clunky at first, but wasn't bad at all once I got used to it. The story and characters in this game are just as bizarre and fantastical as the setting.\nAlthough you can beat the campaign in about 4 hours, I would still highly recomend this game. I found it refreshingly different from any other game I have ever played.

This has to be one of the most awkward games I've ever played. I've never seen such a strange form of story telling. Soo far I'm enjoying the game, if not only because I've never seen anything like it before. I can't even fully describe this game because of how awkward it is. I really do enjoy it though. The story telling and graphics are soo odd. The actual combat itself is lots of fun.  First Person melee fighting sounds awkward but it actually works pretty well. I wish the game was a bit easier to be honest. Don't play on hard your first time through thats for sure. ~PR0XIDIAN
Trippy World, great story. You can tell it's Indie, but you don't grudge it. Definitely worth a look. Don't pass up on sale!

This game has everything you've always wanted (or didn't want) in a video game:

Chneero (a crippled musician who plays music that makes corwids invincible),
Spot on voice acting,
Super dramatic falls (you'll see what I mean),
People in ghili suits with masks that throw pebbles at you,
Rubix Cubes,
Lizard cat people with many boobs that make pig noises when you hit them,
Halucinigenic shrooms,
A tall, transgender chicken who may or may not be a pedophile,
Bugbirds,
Peeing on oneself and starving anonymously,
Sometimes real birds,
Kicks and punches that defy physics,
Magical orange fruits that you must eat to stay alive,
Enemies that can parry your parries,
Lots of cannibalism,
Female" pigs with das booty that have powerfull charges of love
date: \n"I'm gonna shoot yah!" (you'll understand when you hear it)
helpfulPercent: \nCrossbows that are also slingshots that use skulls as ammunition
votesTotal: \n"Statue people" (litterally what the game's official name for them)
votesFunny: \nA torch that throws magical fire that also multifunctions as a melee weapon
commentsCount: \nA rifle that (occasionally) duplicates itself (visually) while you reload it
column16: during the beginning of the game
column18: paratrooping squirrels with bombs attatched to their backs
column19: that are thrown at you by a bounty hunter as he sits atop giant animals (including a dead helicoprion
column20: look it up).\n\nIt's also important to note that their main building material (for EVERYTHING) is bones
column21: and that no one except you believes in pants.\n\nOh and your girlfriend has horns so you can say that she's "horny"."

reviewText: So much originality it’s scary and only explained by dropping multiple tabs while eating all of the marshmallows out of a box of lucky charms. If you like punching things, shooting things, and overall creativity this game is for you.
Twisted story, in twisted world, with twisted weapons and twisted opponents. This game is really different than any other titles.
Beating up weird creatures is pretty satisfying. The fun stops when theres more than one in the area though.
Delightfully bizarre, if a little rough round the edges.

Watching the game unfold before my eyes seriously makes me cringe. Its brutal and very hard hitting.

Its strange because shooting endless goons makes me feel the opposite...

I give it 8.9 basic human animal instincts out of 10

Stylish adventure/brawler game with a plot full of delicious ambiguity. No grindfests here, just adventure, story and fighting, perfectly paced and woven to tell a unique story. It left me wanting more in a good way - I enjoyed beating this and expect to play through it a few more times at least.

About damn time I encountered a game with an original idea...  Its been awhile.

I suppose this game could subsitute for a drug, lots of weird unexplained stuff.
Buy this puppy on sale for 99 cents, not worth full price as its very short.

6.5/10

Zeno Clash is a first person brawler where you occasionally use stone age type guns.  The game is rather short & can be beaten in a few hours.  Overall, it's an enjoyable & unique overall experience that I recommend to anyone wanting to try something different.
Excellent Indie title. Great story combined with a unique fighting system make this one of my favorite indie titles.
The best first person fighter ever
Innovative and refreshing approach to fighting. Universe created by the authors is worryingly strange and surreal but attracts and doesn't allow for itself for a long time to forget.

Oh and you play like this .. blah blah blah, press this and blah. OK, now get incredibly frustrated and die a lot. Have fun!\n\nI wanted to love this game so much, and maybe I just suck at whatever clairvoyant skill the game requires, but it never really worked for me. The combat was constantly wrestling, and I don't mean in-game. The controls and their explanation and practise were vague such that even at the end I was struggling to recall how to do vital actions. The art direction is inspired. The story is wonderfully surreal. It just requires such finnicky manipulation to really excell at it.
Awesome fighting style, very beautiful areas and has an amazing storyline!
It's a trippy linear first person beat-em-up.

You can beat a fat cannibalistic  pig man named Gaben like he ows you money. (is there something you'd like to admit ACE team?)

Seriously though, I love the David Cronenberg-esque aesthetics. The story is confusing, but it fits the wierdness of the aesthetics. The game is the first video game to make me feel like I'm in a fight. the hits are bone-crunching and very satisfying. There are very few FPS games like this. Makes great use of an old engine. It's funny, but my only criticism so far is that the shooting and aiming are not that great, wierd since it's the same engine Valve used to make Half-Life 2 and co.

I really recommend this game. I don't think there is a first person braweler like this except for the hand-to-hand combat in Morrowind.
Nice Action FPS, if I can call it like that, kind of bizarre.\nI recommend it.
Ништяк. Жаль короткая :(
If you are into punching furries, then this is your game.
Never before have i played a brawling game quite like this one.
This is a short on-rails action/adventure that has you solving most problems the right way, with your fists. The setting and story are supremely cool. A lovely experience.
Combine FPS and Fighting games, mixed with the Source Engine, and you have yourself a great game! So worth the buy!
Just plain wierd.  Steam sale!

*Possible Spoilers Below, but not really*

Punched my way to the literal end of the earth and back in about 3 hours.
Enjoyed every second of it. Dont let the short length fool you. This is a fun pc beat em up shooter thing!
A few fights are quite tough, the weapons are interesting, your female sidekick has smoking hot legs and gives you something to stare at while out and about doing your thing, and the story didnt really confuse me at all, there are some things not explained and im sure the sequel will adress those things but what you are presented with while weird, does eventually peace together, leaving some remaining questions after the cliff hanger ending. LIKE!

Why does this world even exist in the first place, and why so many strange creatures along side humans.

What exactly was mother father doing before the intro scene that kicks all this stuff off, i mean sure we get a semi answer, but still. Like what? Wheres the motive.

Are the 2 main characters going to get it on and have like a son or something. Im sure theres already fan fiction of that. Wouldnt shock me.

How many punches would it take to get to the centre of the planet? ID LIKE TO KNOW!

And what are all those things we were promised info on in the end of the game, sequel perhaps? (downloading the second game as i type this)

ANYWAYS, silly questions about a silly but entertaining plot aside. Just uh, buy this ok. Seriosly get both. I want a third game. I want a nice ZENO TRILOGY, to come back to and enjoy. 2 OUT OF 3 FOLKS. JUST ONE MORE GAME AND THE DREAM WOULD BECOME REAL! LEZ GO NOW!
An amazing game. Started it and two hours later had to pull myself away. Can't wait to get back. This world is almost as immersive as Bioshock.
Kinda fun game where u shoot&punch the crap out of weird looking things. 6/10
Fun game, great value, and it can be verey challenging. ENJOY

A difficult game to review.
Having finished the game and looking back and the strange journey that happened I can't help to hope that others experience it to.

If you look beyond the bizare art direction, creepy and odd characters, you will find an amazing and bold story. The strength of the art direction is its characters is that it opens up to story. The world is actually kind of beautiful, in its own brutal kind of way.

Play it as a medium length shooter, enjoy the story and seeing some quirky and odd characters.

Graphics
Kind of an older game so don't expect to be blown away. Once you get used to it you really do kind of smile at its strange way of seeing things.

Gameplay
Enjoyable. You advance at a nice pace and the game really makes you feel like you are progressing.

Sound
Honestly I can't remember the sound. I can't remember being disapointed by it or it grating on me. So theres that.

Game Length
Id say its medium length. You could get about two to three days out of it. But you can beat it in a sitting if you have time.

Story
Strange, enjoyable, if a bit small in scale. It will make you want to shoot them all, and thats all I can ask for in a shooter.

Final Score 8/10.
A fun, strange shooter that will make you want to see what kind of weird zone you will see next. Characters are bonkers. Bad guys make you want to unload clips into them, good guys will make you want to not kill them. Try it, I recommend it.
Simple, funny, sad, philosophical, strange and beautiful, really amazing.

A first person brawler? Sounds a bit goofy, doesn't it? Well good, because that's the way this game like it. This game is a very imaginative and surreal adventure through a world that can be described as a cross between Dr. Seuss and H. R. Giger. The characters and world are chaotically delightful to watch, and the combat is bone-crunchingly visceral.\n\nWorth the look if you're looking for something you will never see anywhere else.

Truly an experience of the fantastic, a lucious physical adventure.  Offers a sick melee side, powerfuly developed both in responsivness but also in the culture of design. Delivered by these honest designer/players -Game really hits home....

A very detailed and unique world, masterfully crafted. The levels are highly linear (which is a shame as they beg to be explored), however this is tempted by a fairly well paced plot and some very interesting and involving first-person fighitng mechanics.\n\nThe game could stand a few more levels, but it was certainly worth it. The Challenge Mode is next to be explored.

This is an oddly unique game. I haven't played it in a while but from what I remember, I enjoyed it. The plot musn't be too good as I've forgotten most of it. I believe it involves you being framed for killing someone important. But, the game doesn't need an intricate plot to keep you entertained. The design of Zeno Clash is unique, to say the least. It's weird, yet beautiful (I'd say it ranks up there with the James Cameron's Avatar universe). The combat is fun and also unique. Instead of shooting, you'll be throwing punches. I recall this game being a decent length and even if it wasn't I'd still recommend it!\n\nGrade: B

One of the better singleplayer experiences you'll have within this game. It beats many AAA games easily. Awesome visuals, crazy but nice story, nice variation in fights, weapons and crazy looking enemies.
The game is compareable with Dark Messiah Might and Magic when it comes to fighting.

You get a lot of game for the price. 9/10
Downside is that I could not find a lot re-playability and the story could have been longer overall.
Gnarly game! definitely grab this on a sale.

Unique IP that is pushed by the story and the combat mechanics. One of the only decent first person brawler games and one of the most original, it's only downsides being that it's pretty linear and the fighting can get quite repetitive. Graphics wise its pretty decent and the sound effects are well suited to the game environment however the voice acting is somewhat lacking and the hitboxes can sometimes be a bit off. 7.5/10

A very fun and original game. Bought it for 3.75 and well worth it uses the source engine in a different way.  Don't be fooled by the less than perfect AI or voice acting but the game is very enjoyable.
you can ♥♥♥♥ off a door
What a fun and innovative game. Fighting the bird guy never gets old. Baaawwwwwk!!

It has explosive squirrels. Just putting that out there.

Funny, weird little game about a totally ridiculous world. I enjoyed the story for the short while it lasted and the gameplay was good if somewhat unresponsive. Challenging at times, but nowhere near frustratingly so.

Buy on 50% sale or more.

Totally worth the price!  Really unique and strangely gorgeous game.  Challenging to the point of frustration in places, but the story is interesting enough to make you want to see it through.\n\nNothing else like it, check it out!

Mais um jogo finalizado aqui. Então, vamos lá.
Este não é um jogo muito grande. Apresenta de 3 a 5 horas no modo campanha.
Tendo mais algumas horas no modo Challenge, que é realmente um desafio.

A história é muito doida e bizarra, vale a pena conferir, pois sai daquela rotina de jogos americanos e japoneses. O cenário é muito bonito, um mundo de fantasia totalmente maluco, com criaturas e costumes próprios.
É um jogo bem diferente, e recomendo que comprem em alguma promoção e que só comprem se realmente curtirem jogos com uma temática diferente.

Eu gostei muito do jogo apesar de ser bem curto, achei a história bem legal e bem maluca, por isso recomendo. Mas recomendo a pessoas que curtam essa temática, lembrem-se disso.

Weird but fun Gameplay. This game is like if acid took you. Voice acting is somewhat hillarious and its probably because the programmers voiced most of it.

So far? Zeno Clash is a lot like what I imagine real life fighting is like. Anyone smart typically has backup so your enemies gang up on you.  While you fight one person, someone sneaks up behind you and punches you in the back of the head while someone else just goes for a gun and tries to shoot you to death.\n\nAlso everyone is ugly and out to get you.  Just like real life.

ZenoClash and it's sequel are both some of the best action titles I have played ever for their price tags. Not only is the artwork fresh and original, the story is intriguing and down right enjoyable. The melee combat system is one of the best I've experienced and can only be compared to Condemned:Criminal Origins. I see #1 is on sale for $2, and honestly, that's so overly generous it's like stealing. If you're a fan of the first, definetly buy the second because it only gets better.\nDo yourself a favor and experience ZenoClash.\nPS. I love you.

Only thing bad about this game is the combat can be hard and tedius(doesn all games have something like that?) and the range combat kind of suck but the story and setting/enviroment is awesome! worth the time just to experience this story.

Es facil definir este juego, original. Juntais un juego FPS y un juego de lucha en un mundo de fantasia diferente a todo lo visto anteriormente y sale Zeno Clash. Sin embargo, no es ni un buen FPS ni un buen juego de lucha. Muchas cosas por pulir... pero el 2 ya esta confirmado. Jugar y borrar

This is an extremely unique first person brawler by an indie Chilean devellopment team. The bizarre Cenozoic setting and even more bizarre character designs flow on amazing fever-dream-logic. The combat is both visceral and substantial, and the individual characters, who you'll likely be seeing a lot of, have very satisfying reactions on their faces to an unexpectedly vicious assault. While the voice acting can be extremely hit-or-miss, the plot itself is both memorable and appropriately bizarre.

You absolutely should buy this game. A really unique melee system derived from the usual tropes: Directional attacks and counters and such. I can run this game on maxed out settings and it will run fine. Also, no viewmodels, the camera ACTUALLY is your head :D The only complaint is that it's really short. Tip if you buy this: Apparently turning steam community in-game on makes it have framerate issues.
I put about 20 hours into this one.  If you enjoy melee builds in Skyrim or Fallout you'll probably enjoy Zeno.  The story is as weird as it looks.

This game takes more than one play-through to appreciate.  Once you get the hang of combat,  the arcade action really gets fun.   I will admit that I gave up on this game twice before I stuck through it.   It takes a bit of time to get used to the combat controls and manage a fight from start to finish (some of the larger fights this is crucial), so you will get frustrated.  Just beat it, and then beat it again.\n\nif you haven't played it yet, just pick it up.  Games this original are hard to find.
Slap shȋt and find cool ways to exploit the AI.
Como leer un buen libro. Es un juego de peleas con un sistema de combate majo, pero lo mejor es la historia: intrigante, ubicada en un mundo de fábula, con unos seres únicos. Muy bueno.

What can you say about Zeno Clash? It's a short, bizarre fever-dream of a game set in a world that is both familliar and surreal. It is dripping with unusual characters like the chief antagonist Father-Mother or the casually mentioned Oximeter, a character whose only goal and purpose is to walk in a straight line.\n\nWhat is the game play like, you ask? It's a first person brawler which is, at times, tense and exciting, but mostly it takes a back seat to everything else.

Unexpected approach to fighting games, I must say. It's the first time I see a first person fighting game and it indeed delivers. Make combos, break faces, use primitive weapons to help you in your fights... It's pretty good, I do not regret buying it.
