Zeno Clash. I'll have to admit I only picked up this game because it was insanely cheap (£0.59) . Having no expectations for the game or no prior knowledge about the game I was presently surprised by what this game had to offer. The story of this game is so damn trippy you will need to buy this game yourself to experiance its awesomely weirdness. The best part about Zeno Clash is its combat system. It is a beat em up but in first person. You can do a variety of punches ranging from jabs to HOLY ♥♥♥♥ YOU JUST MADE THAT GUY FLY ACROSS THE SCREEN. When you successfully pull off harder punches you get a sastifying crunch as you see your enemies face turn into jelly. There are also some guns in the game which are really awkward and are no where near as sastifying to use. I'd recommend this game to people looking for something different it is a short game but baring in mind I got it really cheap on a steam sale im sure you could aswell.
Come for the unique art design, stay for the flawed but engaging brawling action.

reviewText: beautiful and twisted. creepy and colorful. ign compared it to an incan fever dream. the game is mostly a series of first person melee fights... i really didnt think i would be a fan. but play the demo and youll see. theres a good story, the characters are phenomenal, and the fighting doesnt feel repetative. so youre wondering why its only $15 well its short. multiplayer would have been real cool. there is some challenge mode but i cant imagine it adds much more

Be warned this game occasionally feels like a heavily modified HL2 mod, but absolutey nothing in it feels half finished or anything short of deeply considered. The fantastical setting is something truly special and left my jaw hitting the floor more than once. Overall the story is earnest with some occasional understated dark humour, and the action (strong emphisis on melee) satisfyingly brutal, if occasionally janky/frustrating (unless I just suck :p). Weird, unique and weird.

A pure FPS Street Fighter". The coolest thing about this game is the world and characters. There is a visual style here that is like nothing else out there...very unique. I found the combat system to be a little wonky
date: but perhaps I just sucked at it. This is either a game you'll love or hate with a passion."

reviewText: the game is spectacular. its visceral first person fighting done right. the controls are wonky-ish at first, but its amazingly satisfying.

If you can look beyond the bad voice acting, this game is a true example of how good a first-person brawler can be. The combat works really well and the world is amazingly well detailed and bizarre in a good way.
crazy and worth a play through. A good 6-7 hours of story and crazy ♥♥♥♥.

First-person fisticuffs action in an extremely bizarre stone age world.\n\nWorth the buy just to see first-person melee combat done exceptionally right---and satisfyingly. Introducing rapscallions to your kneecaps never gets old.

Zeno Clash is one of those games that you never see, i'm not talking about the story or the graphics or stuff like that, no; i'm speaking of it's originalility, throughout the course of the game, you can tell that practically all of the game was stuff thought directly from the top of the developer's minds, many games should take inspiration from such a game like this, it was hard to decide whether to be in awe or in complete disarray of what you saw in this game.

This game is really weird and original, and has really the only good first-person-view melee combat system I've played.   Really fun visceral feel, I really recommend it.\n\nI have to admit though, I liked it better when you could keep kicking enemies when they were down (they patched it out eventually, I guess it made some fights really easy).    But seriously, kicking guys in the stomach when they were trying to stand up again never got old.

Zeno Clash can be summarized in two words - freaky weird. Imaginative setting that somehow manages to give the impression that you've only just scratched the surface of the world of Zenozoik (and beyond) along with its eerily disturbing and eccentric characters result in a unique experience overall. That's not to say everything deserves praise though, especially in the mechanics department. First-person melee combat is awkward especially with its overreliance on somewhat stubborn focus mode that takes some time getting used to in order to avoid frustration. Not to mention how short the game is, probably as a result of obviously being ACE Team's first effort and consequence their choice to go for a surreal one-time experience.
Atmospheric and truly original.\nIt ♥♥♥♥s PC gamers in the butt, though, by releasing extra content (and multiplayer!) for the consoletards, but nothing for the PC version.

This is a great game that seems to go un-noticed by many. I had tons of fun playing this and really pushed through to the ending to see what the story was all about. Fun gameplay and interesting story make this game a hit.

Weird and wonderful. There really isn't a universe like the one featured in Zeno Clash, and that coupled with the most robust first person fisticuff system makes for one hell of a game. Bonus: The challenge towers are a ton of fun.
Beautiful, strange, crazy world. Creative storyline and flexible combat. A very very great game!!!

An awesome indie first-person fighting game. Awesome world, environment, characters.. everything about this game is top-notch. The fighting is done in a clever and enjoyable way. It doesn't take very long to beat, however.
Short game beatable in one sitting with some of the most creative art I've ever seen in a game. The fighting is visceral and the plot is unique and thought-provoking.
Overflowing with creativity. Truly unique!

Pros: Bizarre, unexpected, tons of personality and a lot of fun. Visceral first-person melee mechanics make combat very unique and engaging. Nightmarish character design and creepy voicework contributes highly to the game's fascinatingly surreal ambience.

Cons: The small levels and strict linearity in progression are disappointing since the world's imaginative environments would be a blast to explore. Also, gamplay can feel repetitive at times since other than dialogue, there is little to break up the consecutive bouts of combat. Some elements of adventuring and exploration would add much to the experience. The game is a bit on the short side with the main story clocking in at about 4-5 hours.

Overall, Zeno Clash is well worth playing and is an experience that is sure to stick with you. I hope there is a sequel.

If you're in the mood for the bizarre you have to try this game. It is set in a fantastical fantasy world with environment and creatures unlike anything I've ever seen. Although there are a few weapons in the game the combat system is centered around melee combat. The system felt slightly clunky at first, but wasn't bad at all once I got used to it. The story and characters in this game are just as bizarre and fantastical as the setting.\nAlthough you can beat the campaign in about 4 hours, I would still highly recomend this game. I found it refreshingly different from any other game I have ever played.

Where to begin, Zeno Clash I guess I Can consider a First Person Brawler with some shooter elements. It shows the perfect example towards independent game development, and proves itself in many ways. The game is fast paced, fun, albeit short, its enjoyable and can be played through more than once. I Did not expect it to be so fun, and was actually disappointed when the game ended. The Challenge mode is welcomed and even though the story is laid out for you except for that one secret, even when it is spoiled in the end, It was a little anti-climatic for myself. The Atmosphere is perfect for the mood they are capturing, Which I personally am still trying to figure out but they did it well. Beautiful, Unique, fun and fast, you can't ask much else from games now a'days, Zeno Clash is worth trying, by everyone, and the developers earn much praise for building such a game, if Zeno Clash had Multiplayer Death Matches, I Feel it would be quite the hit! Overall Zeno Clash is a great game.
One of the strangest game i´ve ever played, but boy is really  fun to punch people in this game
It is a really odd game, good for people who like weird and original ideas. It can get difficult at times and the fighting seems lacking everynow and then but all in all it is a good game.

reviewText: An absolute gorgeous first-person brawler. The character designs and artwork is straight out of a Jim Henson movie like the Dark Crystal. The fighting mechanics are thought out but never too complicated.  The story mode is very short, about 5 hours or so don't expect an epic story. Speaking of story, this is one of the most bizarre games I have EVER played. Check out the demo, I'm sure you won't regret it.

This game reminds my of why I fell in love with older games-- COMPLETELY unique chracters, world/atmosphere, andmonster/s etc.
I got used to the 1st person fighting pretty quickly, but it can be a bit challenging at times and at first.

If you like completely unique game experience with such an odd world/etc, then this game is def. for you!
Story is not very long, I beat this on normal/medium in like 8hrs, but hey-- it's an older game with improved graphics, so it is still fun!

Zeno Clash. I was always intrigued by how this game looked but never got the chance to get my hands on a copy ( until humble bundle :) ) . Ok so let's dwelve into the game. I finished the game on hard difficulty (which is pretty much normal difficulty) in about 3 hours and I can genuinely say I had fun. I wasn't the best of indie games in my oppinion but it was unique. I did find the weapons a bit overpowered though. The story was interesting , yet predictable (though i really liked the way it was narated , with memories and stuff) . The graphics are more than decent considering it's an almost 5 year old indie game . The sound track it's ok I guess but the voices of the characters are annoying sometimes (especially the girl that follows you).

But this game is about the gameplay which is really fun. I haven't played a good fighting game like this since God Hand. I am not a big fan of first person for most of the games , but here it was very enjoyable and it helped immerse the player into the game world. The game world is unique with all types of creatures and weird inhabitants .The combat is fast and you actually have to think your battles a little ahead but sometimes you can exploit ranged weapons(especially fighting The Hunter").

Overall a good game and I would recommend it

It's like Final Fight in three dimensions.  A totally weird game.  It sure gets the adrenaline pumping.  I wish there was more variety in gameplay, as the constant brawling, and the enormous amount of times it takes to bring even a single foe down, wears on the patience quickly.  But it is quite a trip!  I hope the sequel has more variety though.

I'm glad to see this game get a sequel... you can read a wide variety of reviews that love the game or hate the game but one thing that's a constant is they always give the game props for originality and creativity.  The art direction is very enjoyable to me, and if you're a fan of current craze Chivalry" then you'll find a lot to enjoy in this universe.  Three boners out of five."

Pretty fun. The fighting mechanic takes some getting used to, and even then can be a little cumbersome, but it's fun. For running under the Source Engine, the graphics are amazing, especially when it comes to the depth of field effect. The storyline at first makes no sense, but in the end it actually comes together as a very well written game. The only cons of this game are the length and the voice acting. It doesn't take too long, and if you sit down for a while you can probably get it done in a day. The voice acting, I'm not sure if it's purposely bad or not. In a game like this, it may be purposely fake actor-y. That aside, it's really fun.

It's kind of like if double dragon was an fps, and  it was set in some universe which is so ♥♥♥♥ing outlandishly weird that it manages to make sense in it's own way. The fighting mechanics are quite unique and they feel intuitive but without sacrificing options. I haven't been as impressed by a melee fighting system since Mount and Blade tbh. The story is whacky and entertaining too. Be warned that most the gameplay is brawling against opponents. There's some shooting segments and a part which plays almost like a tower defence kind of thing without towers, but in my opinion the brawling mechanics are good enough to justify the game being mostly just that - brawling.\nEven if you don't find it completely enjoyable, it's just too weird and unique of a game not to play through to see what it's like.

Super unique, first-person brawler indie title. The music is odd, story is odd, voice acting is odd, and environments are odd. And yet, I find it charming. Everything is so alienating, but it works to this game's strengths. Makes it stand out, which is probably the reason such a far out concept didn't totally flop.

It's interesting, and worth a full playthrough. Gameplay stays fresh throughout with the well-paced difficulty curve, and varied AI for each enemy. Plus, it's been updated several months after release with some new moves and enemies (the update coincided with the XBLA release of Zeno Clash Ultimate or whatever it was called. They're the same, though, so don't worry.)

Definitely worth it if it's on sale, though I'm fine having payed $20.
Awesome game. Great story, great controls, and great concept.

Action is fast paced and fun I mean I cant remember playing a game where the weapons can be knocked out of your hand and you then fight bare handed. Bare handed is done perfectly to with everything you want fatigue, blocking, dodging and power punching to break the enemy's blocks. You can daze your opponent then throw them, knee them or uppercut them to the ground run over and kick them. You can also run over and throw an elbow. The only games with better fist fighting is fight night and UFC. The guns are pretty original and creative 5 of them then there is grenades and two melee weapons.

Seriously this is one of the best games I have played in a year really became addictive at points challenging but never frustrating. reviewText: This is an extremely unique first person brawler by an indie Chilean devellopment team. The bizarre Cenozoic setting and even more bizarre character designs flow on amazing fever-dream-logic. The combat is both visceral and substantial, and the individual characters, who you'll likely be seeing a lot of, have very satisfying reactions on their faces to an unexpectedly vicious assault. While the voice acting can be extremely hit-or-miss, the plot itself is both memorable and appropriately bizarre.

You absolutely should buy this game. A really unique melee system derived from the usual tropes: Directional attacks and counters and such. I can run this game on maxed out settings and it will run fine. Also, no viewmodels, the camera ACTUALLY is your head :D The only complaint is that it's really short. Tip if you buy this: Apparently turning steam community in-game on makes it have framerate issues.

Unquestionably the best first-person melee combat in any game I've played in my life.  What Mirror's Edge did for running and jumping Zeno Clash does for punching people in the face.  Instead of the usual fixed camera and gimpy limbs, everything is properly weighted and moves naturally, so when you grab someone by the shoulders and give them a knee to the sternum, for once it truly feels right.  The bizarre and surreal style, setting and design of everything only makes it that much better.  Beating people up has never felt so right.
This game looks weird at first glance, but the story is intriguing and immersive.  There is nothing more satisfiying than charging up a punch to knock an enemies ♥♥♥ across the screen!

If you can look beyond the bad voice acting, this game is a true example of how good a first-person brawler can be. The combat works really well and the world is amazingly well detailed and bizarre in a good way.
crazy and worth a play through. A good 6-7 hours of story and crazy ♥♥♥♥.

Zeno Clash is one of those games that you never see, i'm not talking about the story or the graphics or stuff like that, no; i'm speaking of it's originalility, throughout the course of the game, you can tell that practically all of the game was stuff thought directly from the top of the developer's minds, many games should take inspiration from such a game like this, it was hard to decide whether to be in awe or in complete disarray of what you saw in this game.

This game is really weird and original, and has really the only good first-person-view melee combat system I've played.   Really fun visceral feel, I really recommend it.\n\nI have to admit though, I liked it better when you could keep kicking enemies when they were down (they patched it out eventually, I guess it made some fights really easy).    But seriously, kicking guys in the stomach when they were trying to stand up again never got old.

Zeno Clash can be summarized in two words - freaky weird. Imaginative setting that somehow manages to give the impression that you've only just scratched the surface of the world of Zenozoik (and beyond) along with its eerily disturbing and eccentric characters result in a unique experience overall. That's not to say everything deserves praise though, especially in the mechanics department. First-person melee combat is awkward especially with its overreliance on somewhat stubborn focus mode that takes some time getting used to in order to avoid frustration. Not to mention how short the game is, probably as a result of obviously being ACE Team's first effort and consequence their choice to go for a surreal one-time experience.

This game was a pleasant diversion for the money.  It's a first person fighting game that falls into the realm of easy to learn, and difficult to master.  Combine the skillful combat with a truly bizarre world, good voice acting, some unique weapons, and an intriguing story and you have some pretty good bang for the buck.

An excellant first person game with an intense focus on viceral melee and hand to hand combat. An interesting and unique art style was what appealed to me the most. If you can get past some certain moments of Narmy voice acting the story is quite compelling too. Also interesting to note is that the game has both a single player and a 2 player co-op modes, might be fun to play with a friend.

This game's unique and fantastic art design combined with its fun (but far from perfect) combat mechanics make for a very interesting gameplay experience. Even if you happen to dislike gameplay, it's still worth it just to appreciate the brilliant artistic design.

reviewText:
An excellent Indie-Game based on the Source Engine with gripping first-person melee combat and a deep storyline set in a stone age fantasy world.
Unfortunately the voice acting (luckily english only) is not as good as you could be familiar with from other games.
Another disadvantage is the fact that shooter experienced players can finish it in 5 hours (or less).
There is a challenge mode where you can proof your melee combat skills and allows you to post your highscore in your Steam Friends network.

If you are looking for some hours of fun, excitement and brawl in an odd fantasy world, Zeno Clash is _the_ game for you xD
I love this combat, the universe, graphics, story and everything! Great game with great price - must buy.
I'm not one to play a game for its artistic aspects, but this one feels so out there, you have to see it!
Highly recommend this weird masterpiece. Great visuals, nice combat system + time challenges to compete with friends.

If you like great stories, and crazy art.. then this is a must buy!\nI had lots of fun with it. One of those games that you just can't wait to finish to see the ending (when you actually start understanding what's going on... like after 15 minutes in)
Worth the $10 they're asking for it. It's a brawler on psychodelic drugs. Fun and challenging, with a play style that I've not ever seen before.

I really recommend it for having a fascinating style, funky story, and just to see that First-Person-Beat-Em-Up (FPBEM?) can be done well! :D
A much better solo FPS" challenge experience than lots of other games
I've played like all the CODs etc.
It's a real shame there are no co-op modes on the PC though (only on 360) but I don't want to pay the inflated 360 price just for those few extra co-op levels :("

Zeno Clash is a First-Person-Fighter whose faults (including short playtime--I did it in about 3 hours--and sometimes irritating combat) are well outshone by its strange visuals and setting. Zeno Clash uses Fantasy to its best potential and rather than stuff more Orcs, Elves, and Dwarves down your throat it comes up with a wholly unique setting that is both striking and at time mesmerizing. To give you an idea of what the game is really like, I'll quote my favorite piece of dialogue. The Corwids are not slaves of reality; so they can be insane... Here I met Oxameter. Oxameter just walks in a straight line without letting anything change his path
date: and that's what Oxameter does. There was also Helim. Helim needed to be invisible
recommended: so he removed the eyes from anything that could see him.""

The art in this game is just beyond fantastic; definitely an 11/10. The combat is mostly melee, but it's about melee comboing, so simple button mashing usually doesn't work. The combat does get repetitive, but it's still fun. The game introduces what could be an extremely wonderful series, but as of yet nothing else has come from the developers.
If the Dark Crystal, Enslaved, and pure meele combat were combined into one solid package, this would be it. [[8.75 / 10]]

At its core, Xeno Clash is a spiritual successor to arcade beat-em-up games. What sets it apart is the unique, fully-realized world and story the game punctuates the action with in scripted cutscenes and flashbacks that slowly reveal the central mystery of the plot. The game is powered by the Source engine, and true to its linage, the character work in these scenes is top-notch.

The action in Xeno Clash takes place in the first-person, and you chain together punches and throws to form combos, while dodging the enemies' own swings. Besides hand-to-hand combat, you can also scoop up weapons dropped by your foes, such as pistols, a rifle, and grenades. Enemies usually come in waves, but you can easily lock your focus to a specific foe.

The game itself is rather short, and can be finished in a few hours. There's a series of challenge levels to give the game some replay value. But Xeno Clash's presentation, artwork, and story differentiate enough that any gamer should give it a shot.

This game will throw you in an imaginative world where the fight will only scratch the surface of what's beneath. You will go through misteries (that will never be completely clarified) struggling to keep your senses focused on survival instead of letting you go to the visuals and sounds that ACE wonderfully created for this experience.

Wow. It is really impossible to describe this game in words--It is just so far out there, but not in a bad way. You've never played a game like this. Maybe if you have been on acid and LSD simultaneously, you might have a clue. The characters, monsters, story, weapons, and scenery are just plain crazy. With a decent melee combat system, it's hard not to recommend it. Just don't play it with any far fetched expectations and stick with it to the end. Smoking a joint or two before you begin wouldn't hurt either.

An excellent and original mix between fight and shooting, with a superb art which got it nominated for 'Excellence in Visual Art' at the Independent Games Festival, and with good reason. Like sci-fi and fantasy? Like brutal combat? Then what are you waiting for?

Purchased at $10\n\nOne of the best uses of the Source engine ever. Great first person melee combat in one of the strangest worlds to ever grace videogames. You'll say What the f&#$ is that?" at least a dozen times. A very unique title. Unfortunately the sequel has so far disappointed me. I say stick with this game
recommended: and it'll find a place in your memory forever."

reviewText: Interesting game that is for sure, unusual setting, plot, combat, you name it, just a strange ♥♥♥ game, they are making a 2nd one I guess, something to build on here, I wasn't fond of the combat, but some where.  I wouldn't pay more than $4.99 for the game, maybe lower if you can manage, I can't say yes or no on this one, it's all taste really.  I got like 4 hours out of it, and I did have some fun with it.

You ever wondered what it would be like to play a FPS with no actual weapons (that would be firearms and ♥♥♥♥ ..) at your disposal? One of Zeno Clash' many prespectives is precisely to put this into practice. That game is one of a kind with its very peculiar visuals and themes, it's crazy mind-shattering story-line and its arsh and crude fight sequences. You'll at times and alternatively (or simultaneously in any kind of combinations!) feel confused, lost, amazed, overwhelmed, overjoyed, amused, loathed .. but no you've not been hit by a train and you're not dead & dreaming, you've just experienced ZENO CLASH! It's only a bit of a shame that the story ends so fast, not even ten hours will certainly suffice to clear the game in mildly difficult seetings (average) .. gladly it's usually sold at a very affordable price, go get it fools!\n

Imagine if Dr.Seuss' muddle puddle tweetle poodle beetle noodle bottle paddle battle was real, and more like Thunder Dome from Mad Max.

Now you've got Zeno Clash.

It's a highly stylized first person brawler. It feels kind of odd to put that much detail and style into something that you don't look at while you punch everyone, but when you have time to stop to smell the blood spattered roses, it's a nice looking place. The story is a bit meh, and just goes so deep into this worlds bizzare lore that it gets a bit muddled. Really it's just for playing through once and going well that was interesting"
date:
then never touching it again.

Lets hope Zeno Clash 2 is better.

On the other hand
recommended: if Zeno Clash 2 is set in the same world
hoursPlayed: maybe playing this just to get into the lore would be a good idea."

reviewText: Short (<5 hours), but  extremely unusual. It has been on sale for $1. First person shooter that makes shooting inferior to melee (FPM?), with crazy art style, average voice acting, and weirdly entertaining story.

Oh and you play like this .. blah blah blah, press this and blah. OK, now get incredibly frustrated and die a lot. Have fun!\n\nI wanted to love this game so much, and maybe I just suck at whatever clairvoyant skill the game requires, but it never really worked for me. The combat was constantly wrestling, and I don't mean in-game. The controls and their explanation and practise were vague such that even at the end I was struggling to recall how to do vital actions. The art direction is inspired. The story is wonderfully surreal. It just requires such finnicky manipulation to really excell at it.
Awesome fighting style, very beautiful areas and has an amazing storyline!

Quirky and original, Zeno Clash brings beat-em-ups into a twisted Stone Age. The environments are lively and the characters give the game an offbeat personality. The game's combat is brutally fun, but also full of missed potential. The game's short length doesn't help either.

Zeno clash is without a doubt the weirdest game I have ever played, in the most positive sense. The absurdistic world that you venture through never ceased to surprise me, and is at times strangely familiar. The music in Zenoclash is as weird as everything else in this game, and really seals the atmosphere. The voice acting sounds a bit shoddy though, although that might be intentional. I'm not really sure if it's a good or a bad thing, but I suppose it's another small contributor to the strangest, most bizare atmosphere you will ever encounter in a computergame. The game offers a unique experience to the player. The game may be a bit short, (you can probably finish the game in about 5 hours or so) but after finishing the storyline, you can also give the tower challenges" a try. The tower challenges are basically a sort of gauntlet in which you fight against all the enemies which you have encountered during the storyline. I would give this game 78/100."
Wonderful Game!
Very interesting game with great combat ideas and awsome bizzare  world 8,5/10
Very original and interesting game. Piece of art really.

perfect example of dont judge a book by its cover. i bought this game as a plug-in for another ggame and never thought id realy play it but i figured since i payed good money for this id give it a try. im amazed by it and the only thing i didnt like were the controls

Others may disagree with me, but I found Zeno Clash pretty enjoyable. The combat feels like it accomplishes what ACE is trying to do, the art direction is very interesting, the game has pretty nice graphics (considering it's a source game), and the music is pretty fantastic IMO. If you can get past some bad/un-understandable voice acting (you really should enable subtitles), then you'd like this game.\nIt also comes with FREE GMOD MODELS!!!!!1!!11!!!one1!!!!
Quite a unique little first person shooter. If you like FPS but have gotten bored of the overused ww2/modern warfare themes then this is your game.
30 minutes in...this game is soooo weird: Tim Burton and that monster from Pan's Labrinth made a baby...it was a video game.

Wow, where to begin.  This game exudes creativity and innovation unlike most any of ttitle that I've played in recent memory.  The theme, setting, story, characters and gameplay mechanics are truly unique amongst the sea of clones, sequels and remakes.  Can be a tad repitive in spots but its not a long game and the story keeps it interesting.

Unquestionably the best first-person melee combat in any game I've played in my life.  What Mirror's Edge did for running and jumping Zeno Clash does for punching people in the face.  Instead of the usual fixed camera and gimpy limbs, everything is properly weighted and moves naturally, so when you grab someone by the shoulders and give them a knee to the sternum, for once it truly feels right.  The bizarre and surreal style, setting and design of everything only makes it that much better.  Beating people up has never felt so right.
This game looks weird at first glance, but the story is intriguing and immersive.  There is nothing more satisfiying than charging up a punch to knock an enemies ♥♥♥ across the screen!

If you can look beyond the bad voice acting, this game is a true example of how good a first-person brawler can be. The combat works really well and the world is amazingly well detailed and bizarre in a good way.
crazy and worth a play through. A good 6-7 hours of story and crazy ♥♥♥♥.

First-person fisticuffs action in an extremely bizarre stone age world.\n\nWorth the buy just to see first-person melee combat done exceptionally right---and satisfyingly. Introducing rapscallions to your kneecaps never gets old.
Unlike its sequel, Zeno Clash is a solid, unique fighting game with probably the most original and odd art design from anything I've seen.
Damn, this game is a trip.

I'm glad to see this game get a sequel... you can read a wide variety of reviews that love the game or hate the game but one thing that's a constant is they always give the game props for originality and creativity.  The art direction is very enjoyable to me, and if you're a fan of current craze Chivalry" then you'll find a lot to enjoy in this universe.  Three boners out of five."

Pretty fun. The fighting mechanic takes some getting used to, and even then can be a little cumbersome, but it's fun. For running under the Source Engine, the graphics are amazing, especially when it comes to the depth of field effect. The storyline at first makes no sense, but in the end it actually comes together as a very well written game. The only cons of this game are the length and the voice acting. It doesn't take too long, and if you sit down for a while you can probably get it done in a day. The voice acting, I'm not sure if it's purposely bad or not. In a game like this, it may be purposely fake actor-y. That aside, it's really fun.

It's kind of like if double dragon was an fps, and  it was set in some universe which is so ♥♥♥♥ing outlandishly weird that it manages to make sense in it's own way. The fighting mechanics are quite unique and they feel intuitive but without sacrificing options. I haven't been as impressed by a melee fighting system since Mount and Blade tbh. The story is whacky and entertaining too. Be warned that most the gameplay is brawling against opponents. There's some shooting segments and a part which plays almost like a tower defence kind of thing without towers, but in my opinion the brawling mechanics are good enough to justify the game being mostly just that - brawling.\nEven if you don't find it completely enjoyable, it's just too weird and unique of a game not to play through to see what it's like.
Totally unique and unavoidably challenging, fighter and FPS fans should both have a look.
i find this game so disturbing
Really odd game with a weird story line. I loved it.
First person surreal punching simulator. 10/10
gud

One of the most unearthly game release, which does not make sense. I do not recommend!

FIN:

Yksi kaikkien aikojen älyttömin peli julkaisu, jossa ei ole mitään järkeä. En suosittele!
A pleasant surprise. Strange and well thought out. At the moment it is only a dollar, skip the coffee and make this investment.\n\n10/10 would not drink the Coffee.

This game is an underrated gem. It's a first-person beat-em-up. Though I will say that some of the production could have been tighter, primarily in character animation, the surreal plot, characters, setting and gameplay are a great change of pace from the orange-and-blue that AAA studios love.

I completed the game and tried bit of the arena, I like the impression it made on me.
Don't expect 3rd gen quality. Textures lack a bit here and there, same as the world detail level which is quite simplistic overall but with use of blur, fog, lightning and interesting surreal design the game manages to conceal it perfectly and it definitely works for me. Character design is again simplistic yet amazing and fairly high detailed at some parts.
Combat and enemies are bit repetitive but challenging in a good way. Game sets you up against them in slightly different situations and environment and again manages to conceal what it’s lacking.
Story is nicely confusing but lacking emotionally a little. Then again it's a surreal universe and who know what mentality and emotional approach people might have there.
Music is nothing out of the ordinary and could be better but it corresponds with the action rather well.
Game doesn’t seem to suffer from any major bugs, definitely nothing that couldn't be solved with quick load. I got stuck once trough the cause of the whole game and once my enemy got stuck outside of the fight area and I had to bounce grenades of the wall to kill him around the corner as he was out of my reach.
This brings us to the level design that is simplistic, linear and not at all open world like but it serves the games purpose. Which in my opinion is to tell a surreal story that you could then tell to your children for not such a good night sleep :)
Story is interesting and bit surreal with a solid ending, yet PG12 or less. The game overall is very short which is disappointing, but it includes survival arena like mode for those that would like to experience the game bit more.
Overall 7 out of 10. Game is solid but lacks in graphic, music, emotional storytelling, enemies and weapon varieties level design and game length. Seems it is a low budget game, yet it has a similar effect on me that Dreamfall - The Longest Journey or Bioshock had back when I played them - somehow enchanting. It manages to conceal its flaws with overall good concept, solid design and interesting fighting system. It brings a bit of fresh air in to the FPS genre, and with its low price it's a must have.
I absolutely love this game.  The surrealism is on point and beautifully done from the environments to the characters, brilliance is all around in all it's odd glory.
If you wanna trip balls, but are to scared to do drugs, play this
This is the only game worth playing.

If you like weird, this is the game for you. If you like fighting games like Naruto, this is the game for you. If you like FPSs, this is the game for you. Finally, if you like weird trippy artwork that could be considered a masterpiece, alongside weird comedy that you want to laugh at, but also makes you want to cry, this is THE game for you.
If you ever wanted to beat the crap out of a Dalí painting.
Well.... That was.... Something.\n\nStill a good game.
Man, this game is so close to perfect that it's painful. As a first person brawler"
recommended: and the strange graphics and Euro-comics inspired world make this game a visual treat.  Be warned that the half-baked story ends on a cliff-hanger; it's obvious these guys bit off more than they could chew. But if you like unusual enviroments and a mix of combat styles

reviewText: Picked this up during the Christmas sale because it looked interesting, and found that I was completely ashamed for not getting it earlier.  Excellent game, unique and finely crafted atmosphere, imaginative story, and a blast to play.  Not just a highly competent shooter, but also features the very best first-person hand-to-hand combat in any game I've ever played.
A" game.  Played through this several times. The story and art style are like J. Henson and Dali had a linked nightmare on acid. Tons of great stuff

Weeeird. This might be one of the weirdest games on Steam. I can't even begin to describe just how weird it is. You'll just have to play it. It's a fun game with some pretty engaging melee combat. I'd say it's well worth your time just because it's so unique.
Very weird and surreal, yet fantastic and unique. This game will stick with you long after you play it. The only downside is that it's too short.

I bought this game when it was on sale for around a dollar or two.... (it looked to be something different and unique..)
Boy I was surprised... This game is very unique! in many ways
It has an awesome story! Awesome atmosphere and beautiful landscapes.. (a true dream world) The characters were awesome, all of them, some beautiful creature design)
Gameplay is fantastic!

It has Fantastic music!!
The graphics are not top-notch, but for the setting they are fantastic. The performance of the game is about a 8.1.  pretty good.

I would love to play more games like this, and especially any sequels that would come from this game!!!!
I would say this game is worth the $15 price tag...  and I got it for a hell of a price during one of Steam's sales.

The only really dissapointing thing is the campaign is short....

I have completed the game, I have not played the challenges, but I will before I uninstall.

This is a pretty underrated little title. It's unique to say the least. While the combat is somewhat repetitive at times, the game will have you guessing on where the oddness and narrative will take you. For this low price, Zeno Clash will be sticking out in your mind for a while.

Crazy, but interesting, game. It's a first-person fighter, really. There are sometimes guns that you can pick up and use, but they are something you'll probably pick up, shoot, then toss instead of reloading. The world is bizarre and wonderful to be in. The story itself is quite intersting. And, of course, the art of everything in this game is just so amazing. It's just a really fun, out-there kind of game. Note that it can be difficult sometimes, and you'll really need to learn how to block and counter moves if you want to succeed.

tl;dr
Good game. Buy it.

A stylish game with a very distinct world and unique story.... but marred by really bad hand-to-hand combat.  If you can muddle through the game" part of this title it is worth playing to experience the fairy-tale."

It's a combination of fighting and shooter FPP game. A bit twisted but interesting storyline. Really impressive graphics as for Source engine (unique world project, textures and stuff). Worth playing ^^
A prime example of indie deliciousness.

An interesting blend of first person shooter and fighting elements, this should please both catagories. With a short but satisfying and deep story mode, people who love a good yarn will be drawn into the world.\nFor those who like to punish themselves, there is a challenge mode which should prove taxing for even the best.

Stylistically, this game feels like a cross between a dream and a Dali painting. Which is to say, pretty damn fine. However, the combat was a little bland and suffered from too many actions being bound to the E key. The game is only a few hours long though, so it will be over before you get too frustrated.\n\nI would totally suggest everyone play this game.

An absolute gorgeous first-person brawler. The character designs and artwork is straight out of a Jim Henson movie like the Dark Crystal. The fighting mechanics are thought out but never too complicated.  The story mode is very short, about 5 hours or so don't expect an epic story. Speaking of story, this is one of the most bizarre games I have EVER played. Check out the demo, I'm sure you won't regret it.

This game reminds my of why I fell in love with older games-- COMPLETELY unique chracters, world/atmosphere, andmonster/s etc.
I got used to the 1st person fighting pretty quickly, but it can be a bit challenging at times and at first.

If you like completely unique game experience with such an odd world/etc, then this game is def. for you!
Story is not very long, I beat this on normal/medium in like 8hrs, but hey-- it's an older game with improved graphics, so it is still fun!
9/5/10, 4.5/5 stars
